clinical_study.brief_title: Sofosbuvir/Velpatasvir in Adolescents and Children With Chronic HCV Infection
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Open-Label, Multicenter, Multi-cohort Study to Investigate the Safety and Efficacy of Sofosbuvir/Velpatasvir in Adolescents and Children With Chronic HCV Infection

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will have 2 parts: Pharmacokinetics (PK) Lead-in Phase and the Treatment Phase.
The primary objective of the PK Lead-in Phase is to evaluate the steady state PK and confirm the dose of sofosbuvir/velpatasvir (SOF/VEL) fixed-dose combination (FDC) in pediatric participants with chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection.
The primary objective of the Treatment Phase is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of SOF/VEL for 12 weeks in pediatric participants with chronic HCV.

primary_outcome.measure: For the PK Lead-in Phase, PK Parameter: AUCtau of Velpatasvir (VEL), Sofosbuvir (SOF), and its Metabolite GS-331007
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 12 hours postdose
primary_outcome.description: AUCtau is defined as concentration of drug over time (the area under the concentration verses time curve over the dosing interval).

primary_outcome.measure: For the Treatment Phase, Percentage of Participants Experiencing Any Treatment-Emergent Adverse Event (AE) with a Focus on AEs Leading to Discontinuation of Study Drug

secondary_outcome.measure: For the PK Lead-in Phase, HCV RNA from Baseline Through Day 7
For the PK Lead-in Phase, Any Adverse Event Leading to Permanent Discontinuation of Study Drug
For the Treatment Phase, Proportion of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response (SVR) 12 Weeks After Discontinuation of Therapy (SVR12)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR12 is defined as HCV RNA < the lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ) at 12 weeks after stopping study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: For the Treatment Phase, Proportion of Participants With SVR at 4 Weeks After Discontinuation of Therapy (SVR4)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR4 is defined as HCV RNA < LLOQ at 4 weeks after stopping study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: For the Treatment Phase, Proportion of Participants With SVR at 24 Weeks After Discontinuation of Therapy (SVR24)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR 24 is defined as HCV RNA < LLOQ at 24 weeks after stopping study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: For the Treatment Phase, Proportion of Participants With Virologic Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Virologic failure is defined as: On-treatment virologic failure: Breakthrough (confirmed HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ after having previously had HCV RNA < LLOQ while on treatment), or Rebound (confirmed > 1 log10 IU/mL increase in HCV RNA from nadir while on treatment), or Non-response (HCV RNA persistently ≥ LLOQ through 8 weeks of treatment) Virologic relapse: Confirmed HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ during the posttreatment period having achieved HCV RNA < LLOQ at last on-treatment visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: For the Treatment Phase, Proportion of Participants With HCV RNA < LLOQ On Treatment
For the Treatment Phase, Emergence of Viral Resistance to SOF and/or VEL During Treatment and When Treatment is Discontinued
For the Treatment Phase, HCV RNA Change from Baseline
For the Treatment Phase, Quality of Life as Measured by PedsQL™ Pediatric Quality of Life Survey
For the Treatment Phase, Growth and Development as Measured by Height
For the Treatment Phase, Growth and Development as Measured by Weight
For the Treatment Phase, Growth and Development as Measured by by Tanner Stage Assessment
For the Treatment Phase, Growth and Development as Measured by Parental Height
For the Treatment Phase, Growth and Development as Measured by Bone Age
For the Treatment Phase, Acceptability of SOF/VEL as Measured by a Questionnaire to Assess Swallowability and Palatability at Day 1
For the Treatment Phase, Acceptability of SOF/VEL as Measured by a Questionnaire to Assess Swallowability and Palatability at Week 12

arm_group.arm_group_label: PK Lead-in Phase: Cohort 1 (12 to < 18 years old)
arm_group.description: SOF/VEL FDC (1 x 400/100 mg tablet or 2 x 200/50 mg tablets) for 7 days

arm_group.arm_group_label: PK Lead-in Phase: Cohort 2 (6 to < 12 years old)
arm_group.description: Pending PK and safety results from Cohort 1, participants in Cohort 2 will initiate and receive SOF/VEL FDC (age-appropriate dose) for 7 days.

arm_group.arm_group_label: PK Lead-in Phase: Cohort 3 (3 to < 6 years old)
arm_group.description: Pending PK and safety results from Cohort 2, participants in Cohort 3 will initiate and receive SOF/VEL FDC (age-appropriate dose) for 7 days.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Treatment Phase: Group 1 (12 to < 18 years old)
arm_group.description: Participants from the PK Lead-in will immediately rollover into Treatment Phase with no interruption of study drug administration until the appropriateness of the dose has been confirmed by PK and safety results from the PK Lead-in. Additional participants (12 to < 18 years of age) will be enrolled in the Treatment Phase upon confirmation of the appropriateness of the dose from the PK Lead-in Phase and will receive SOF/VEL FDC for 12 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Treatment Phase: Group 2 (3 to < 12 years old)
arm_group.description: Participants from the PK Lead-in will immediately rollover into Treatment Phase with no interruption of study drug administration until the appropriateness of the dose has been confirmed by PK and safety results from the PK Lead-in. Additional participants (3 to < 12 years of age) will be enrolled in the Treatment Phase upon confirmation of the appropriateness of the dose from the PK Lead-in Phase and will receive SOF/VEL FDC for 12 weeks.

intervention.description: FDC tablet administered orally once daily

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic HCV-infected, treatment-naive and treatment-experienced adolescent and pediatric individuals aged 3 to < 18 as determined at Day 1.
Note: Other protocol defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply.
